paragraphs.content: Chapter 25
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 25

paragraphs.content: These are also proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.
paragraphs.contentHtml: These are also proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.

paragraphs.content: It is the glory of God to conceal a thing: but the honour of kings is to search out a matter.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It is the glory of God to conceal a thing: but the honour of kings is to search out a matter.

paragraphs.content: The heaven for height, and the earth for depth, and the heart of kings is unsearchable.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The heaven for height, and the earth for depth, and the heart of kings is unsearchable.

paragraphs.content: Take away the dross from the silver, and there shall come forth a vessel for the finer.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Take away the dross from the silver, and there shall come forth a vessel for the finer.

paragraphs.content: Take away the wicked from before the king, and his throne shall be established in righteousness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Take away the wicked from before the king, and his throne shall be established in righteousness.

paragraphs.content: Put not forth thyself in the presence of the king, and stand not in the place of great men:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Put not forth thyself in the presence of the king, and stand not in the place of great men:

paragraphs.content: For better it is that it be said unto thee, Come up hither; than that thou shouldest be put lower in the presence of the prince whom thine eyes have seen.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For better it is that it be said unto thee, Come up hither; than that thou shouldest be put lower in the presence of the prince whom thine eyes have seen.

paragraphs.content: Go not forth hastily to strive, lest thou know not what to do in the end thereof, when thy neighbour hath put thee to shame.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Go not forth hastily to strive, lest thou know not what to do in the end thereof, when thy neighbour hath put thee to shame.

paragraphs.content: Debate thy cause with thy neighbour himself; and discover not a secret to another:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Debate thy cause with thy neighbour himself; and discover not a secret to another:

paragraphs.content: Lest he that heareth it put thee to shame, and thine infamy turn not away.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lest he that heareth it put thee to shame, and thine infamy turn not away.

paragraphs.content: A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver.

paragraphs.content: As an earring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, so is a wise reprover upon an obedient ear.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As an earring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, so is a wise reprover upon an obedient ear.

paragraphs.content: As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, so is a faithful messenger to them that send him: for he refresheth the soul of his masters.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, so is a faithful messenger to them that send him: for he refresheth the soul of his masters.

paragraphs.content: Whoso boasteth himself of a false gift is like clouds and wind without rain.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whoso boasteth himself of a false gift is like clouds and wind without rain.

paragraphs.content: By long forbearing is a prince persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh the bone.
paragraphs.contentHtml: By long forbearing is a prince persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh the bone.

paragraphs.content: Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee, lest thou be filled therewith, and vomit it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee, lest thou be filled therewith, and vomit it.

paragraphs.content: Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbour’s house; lest he be weary of thee, and so hate thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbour’s house; lest he be weary of thee, and so hate thee.

paragraphs.content: A man that beareth false witness against his neighbour is a maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A man that beareth false witness against his neighbour is a maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow.

paragraphs.content: Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble is like a broken tooth, and a foot out of joint.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble is like a broken tooth, and a foot out of joint.

paragraphs.content: As he that taketh away a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon nitre, so is he that singeth songs to an heavy heart.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As he that taketh away a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon nitre, so is he that singeth songs to an heavy heart.

paragraphs.content: If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat; and if he be thirsty, give him water to drink:
paragraphs.contentHtml: If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat; and if he be thirsty, give him water to drink:

paragraphs.content: For thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head, and the LORD shall reward thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head, and the Lord shall reward thee.

paragraphs.content: The north wind driveth away rain: so doth an angry countenance a backbiting tongue.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The north wind driveth away rain: so doth an angry countenance a backbiting tongue.

paragraphs.content: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman and in a wide house.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman and in a wide house.

paragraphs.content: As cold waters to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As cold waters to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country.

paragraphs.content: A righteous man falling down before the wicked is as a troubled fountain, and a corrupt spring.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A righteous man falling down before the wicked is as a troubled fountain, and a corrupt spring.

paragraphs.content: It is not good to eat much honey: so for men to search their own glory is not glory.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It is not good to eat much honey: so for men to search their own glory is not glory.

paragraphs.content: He that hath no rule over his own spirit is like a city that is broken down, and without walls.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that hath no rule over his own spirit is like a city that is broken down, and without walls.
